identificationModule.officialTitle: Allergen Provocations at Hans Christian Andersen Children's Hospital

descriptionModule.briefSummary: A prospective study of all allergen provocations performed in children at the Hans Christian Andersen Children's Hospital.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
The purpose of the study is to investigate the impact of co-morbidities, history, and allergen tests on the outcome of allergen provocation tests.

Subjects are children aged 0-18 years old investigated for allergy to foods or antibiotics. Data entered in the database are demographics, co-morbidities, symptoms, SPT, specific IgE and details of the allergen provocations.

primaryOutcomes.description: The value of specific IgE and SPT to predict the outcome of a allergen provocation

references.citation: Gradman J, Petersen BT, Halken S. Oral food challenge with raw egg: Sixty-minute- compared with 30-minute dosing interval. Clin Exp Allergy. 2022 Sep;52(9):1114-1117. doi: 10.1111/cea.14187. Epub 2022 Jul 4. No abstract available.
